quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Weather and Kind
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, frost, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first frost will come within this many days, after you hear the first cicada.
Does liquid iron float on liquid nickel?
A reddish ring around the moon means this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rain or snow

questions.question: A piece of wood floating on the ocean has what kind of buoyancy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Positive buoyancy

questions.question: What is a hydrometer?

options.text: An instrument used to measure a liquids temperature
An instrument used to measure a liquids weight
An instrument used to measure a liquids density

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An instrument used to measure a liquids density

questions.question: This flower opens up in sunny weather. When rain is expected, it closes tightly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scarlet Pimpernel

questions.question: Does hydrogen float on helium?
What does volumetric flow rate mean?

options.text: The volume of fluid which passes through a given volume per unit time
The resistance of a fluid to deform under shear stress

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The volume of fluid which passes through a given volume per unit time

questions.question: Does gasoline float on distilled water?
These are often used as weather indicators. Before the weather gets dry, they open up. If it will be wet, they return to their normal shape.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pine cones

questions.question: What does laminar flow mean?

options.text: The movement of a liquid past a bumpy object. (Water past rapids)
The movement of a liquid in straight line (Water in a straw)
The movement of a liquid in space, outside the planet Earth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The movement of a liquid in straight line (Water in a straw)

questions.question: If the crow has any interruption in her note like hiccup, or a croak with a kind of swallowing, it signifies this event.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wind and rain

questions.question: Does liquid mercury float on liquid gold?
If at noon on the 2nd of February you see this animals shadow, be sure the weather will be cold.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A groundhog

questions.question: Such the weather will be if at dusk the sky is red.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Jupiter and Storm
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, birds, jupiter. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The word hurricane” comes from the name of a Caribbean god - Huracan. Huracan was god of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The storms

questions.question: A tropical cyclone is a storm with a closed circulation around a center of low pressure. Based on strength and location a tropical cyclone can be referred to by different names. Which of the following is not a possible name for a tropical cyclone?
You should expect this, if fish jump out of the water while the weather is nice.
Despite a hurricane’s destructive nature and its toll on both lives and property, there are some beneficial effects of tropical cyclones.
According to the distance between the planets and the Sun, Jupiter is situated between which two planets in the Solar system?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars and Saturn

questions.question: A tropical cyclone is classified to have reached landfall when the outer edges of the storm are over land.
What is the minimum ocean water temperature required for a tropical cyclone to form?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 80 degrees Fahrenheit

questions.question: How do the Korean, the Japanese and the Chinese call Jupiter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wood star

questions.question: Once a tropical cyclone reaches wind speeds of at least 39 mph, it is classified as a tropical storm. At what minimum wind speed is a tropical storm classified as a hurricane or typhoon?
If the tail of these animals appears thicker,  then you could expect a severe winter.
How many moons, revolving around Jupiter, did Galileo Galilei discover in the 17th century?
Jupiter, the fifth planet from the Sun, has atmosphere composed of what gases?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hydrogen and helium

questions.question: In 1994, what major hurricane broke the record for longest-lasting hurricane ever observed both in the Pacific Ocean and worldwide?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hurricane John

questions.question: If these birds do run for shelter during rain, the weather is going to get worse.
The constant anticyclonic storm on Jupiter which can be seen through telescopes from Earth is called by what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Red Spot

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Prescription and Jupiter
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, jupiter, reads. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these names refers to a large group of asteroids in Jupiters orbit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Trojan asteroids

questions.question: What are the abbreviations on prescriptions called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sig codes

questions.question: The first directly-observed collision between two solar system bodies was between Jupiter and which comet?
The four Jovian planets in the Solar system are Jupiter, Saturn, Neptune and which other planet?
If a prescription has the terms NS and OS written on it, what does this probably mean?

options.text: You cant get more of your ulcer medication.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You have an eye problem.

questions.question: Which of these is not one of the four main parts that make up a prescription?
Should I eat before taking my medication, if the prescription says the medication should be taken a.c.?
Which one is not a name of a Galilean moon revolving around Jupiter?
Which of these is used to indicate the medication should be taken with food?
This woman was the first female licensed physician in Great Britain. She died on December 17, 1917 at the age of 81.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Garrett Anderson

questions.question: In a pharmacy setting, what does ft. mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: let it be made

questions.question: Jupiter, the largest planet in the Solar system, is the ruling planet of which astrological sign?
Pregnancy has a lot of myths surrounding it. Is this one of them? Do spicy foods and/or red wine help induce labor?
Which of these would most likely appear on a prescription if the medication should be taken as a large single dose?
If the prescription reads take 2 IBU 400mg Tab PO BID p.c. disp. q.s. 5 days DAW, how many ibuprofen tablets should be dispensed?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Planet and Nose
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, stars, ice. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This can be viewed as a generalization of the Pythagorean Theorem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Law of Cosines

questions.question: What do you call a massive system of stars held together by gravity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A galaxy

questions.question: A solar eclipse is when Earth casts a shadow on the Moon.
Which of these equations can describe the Theorem of Pythagoras?
This Solar System body was once considered a planet, but was later reclassified as a dwarf planet and a member of the Kuiper Belt.
Meteoroids are small celestial bodies consisting of ice, dust and rock that form gaseous tails as they move closer to the Sun.
This is sometimes called Eulers Formula.
If youre double-jointed, it means you have two joints where normally there is one.
The nose is an amazing piece of the human body.  Every flower or food gives off odor molecules that your nose picks up and your brain translates. How many smells can your brain recognize?
Which planet of the Solar System has the most moons?
Which of the following asteroids is the only one visible to the naked eye?
If a dog is wagging its tail, then it is safe to approach.
Which of these countries has the highest infant mortality rate according to a 2006 revision of the UN World Population Prospects report?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United States

questions.question: I think we have all heard this one. Does an apple a day keep the doctor away?
Which is the hottest planet of the Solar System?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Equation and Plant
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, amazon, cape. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: x^2+y^2=r^2 is which equation?

options.text: the equation of a right triangle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the equation of a circle

questions.question: What does this equation describe?  y=A(sin) wt, where A is the amplitude and t is the time.

options.text: The tangent of the angle x
The cosine of the angle w

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simple harmonic motion

questions.question: This is one of the major equations of relativity.
Which drug consists of a sediment, extracted form the fruit of the squirting cucumber, that is native of the the Mediterranean region?
This tree, which grows mainly in Australia, is the tallest of all flowering evergreen plants.
Given the equation C=pi*D. What does the C and the D stand for?

options.text: The circumference and diameter of a circle
The electrical capacitance and the electrical dipole
The circular radius and the diopter distance
The cranial area and the circumspectum

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The circumference and diameter of a circle

questions.question: Which plant, that grows in the equatorial rainforests of Sumatra, Indonesia, has the largest unbranched inflorescence in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Titan arum

questions.question: This equation, Y=mX+B, represents what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A line in the plane

questions.question: This plant, native to the shallow waters of the Amazon River basin, is the largest representative of waterlilies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victoria waterlily

questions.question: Which tree, that grows on the Canary Islands, Cape Verde and Madeira, secretes a reddish juice, called Dragons blood?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dracaena draco

questions.question: What is this equation?  F=G*m1*m2/d^2

options.text: the atomic number of an isotope of uranium at distance d from the nucleus
the force of gravity between two bodies of masses m1 and m2 at distance d
the  thermal force between two masses, m1 and m2 at a distance d from the isothermal center
the focal length of a lens of diopter length m1 and m2 at distance d

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the force of gravity between two bodies of masses m1 and m2 at distance d

questions.question: What is the name of this famous theorem?  If x, y, and z are non-zero positive integers, then x^n+y^n=z^n has no solution if n is an integer greater than two.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fermats Theorem

questions.question: This type of orchid, discovered by Charles Darwin, is pollinated by the hawkmoth, an insect with a long tongue.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Comet Orchid

questions.question: Drosera, an insectivorous plant that grows in South Africa, South America and Australia, attracts the insects to its tips in what way?

options.text: By its smell of rotting meat

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By its dew-drop appearance

questions.question: Rafflesia, a parasitic plant found in southeastern Asia, has flowers, which smell like what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rotting meat

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Satellite and Moon
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, field, jupiter. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This natural satellite, named after Neptunes son from the Greek Mythology, is the largest moon of the planet Neptune.
Which natural satellite is Jupiters largest moon as well as the largest moon in the whole Solar System?
What is the fifth largest moon of Jupiter, named after the nymph of Greek Mythology, who nursed young Zeus (Jupiter) with goat milk.
The German word edelweiss, referring to one of the most famous European mountain flowers, means what in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Noble and white

questions.question: Isabella took a test that had 20 questions.  The total grade was computed by awarding 10 points for each correct answer and deducting 5 points for each incorrect answer. Isabella answered all 20 questions and received a score of 125. How many answers did Isabella get incorrect?
This asteroid, orbiting around the sun, is sometimes called the second moon of the Earth but it is not a real satellite.
This moon, bearing the name of the ferryman of the dead in Greek mythology, is the largest satellite of Pluto.
What is the name of the largest moon of Saturn and the second largest moon in the Solar System, which was the first satellite to be discovered after the discovery of the four Galilean moons?
Cupid, named after a character in a Shakespearean play and discovered in 2003 with the help of the Hubble telescope, is a small natural satellite of which planet?

In 2002 Ericsson signed a joint agreement with a vendor, whose advanced silicon technology would be used in the core components for Ericssons GPRS and 3G reference design platforms.  Who was that vendor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas Instruments

questions.question: Three dogs and two puppies weigh 128 lbs. Four dogs and three puppies weigh 176 lbs. All dogs weigh the same and all puppies weigh the same. What is the weight of two dogs and one puppy?
Which natural satellite of Saturn is characterized by its irregular shape, unexplained sponge-like appearance and chaotic rotation?
Which company demonstrated the first GPRS mobile phone with video-on-demand in March of 2002?
This space object, named after the mythological son of Ares (Mars), is the larger and innermost of Mars two moons, orbiting closer to its major planet than any other satellite in the Solar System.
Which two planets of the Solar System, characterized by a low magnetic field, have no moons at all?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mercury and Venus
